Issues.Title: Angular auto binding issue
Issues.Body:
Auto-updating/binding component dynamically is not working in angular 10.0.x when using the API data.
It appears the updated data only when you give any keyboard or mouse click event

Issues.Title: fix(animations): properly track listeners for a removed element
Issues.Body:
**NOTE**: this is a fix from PR #35241 created by Matias and closed earlier. The fix is still valid and needed (helps resolve a few targets internally).

Prior to this patch, if an element was removed multiple times (due
to the nature of parent/child elements), the leave listeners may
have been fired for an element that was already removed. This patch
adds a guard within the animations code to prevent this.


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(animations): properly track listeners for a removed element" (#40712)

Issues.Title: Angular Dashboard Framework & Ng New Schematics/--collection
Issues.Body:
There is a **huge void for business applications using dashboards**. While this is prevalent in most applications, every time I do a site/app for a company, they have an angular dashboard, I noticed people reinventing the wheel, every single time, and most often its common requirements implement wrong. If you look at Java JSR just around dashboards, but many are trying to retrofit angular in there. 


### Description
This both a feature request and a sample, so we can create schematics of an base dashboard that can house responsive widgets that communicate with each other/ using collections `--collection Widgets/Dashboard`



i.e. a dashboard sample and CLI scaffold to similar to creating a page, it would be very helpful to create a dashboard with widgets, which can communicate with each other.



![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21086190/106695713-29cb4d80-65a9-11eb-993d-7832d8cf7b72.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21086190/106695734-32238880-65a9-11eb-9edf-ed36231cce4c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Dashboard Framework & Ng New Schematics/--collection " (#40681)

Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description Fix example in documentation Component with async service ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/guide/testing-components-scenarios#component-with-async-service ### Reproduction Steps** - Make use of jasmine.createSpyObj for any testing scenario ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** Correct operation vs TypeError: jasmine.createSpyObj is not a function ## üì∑Screenshot [Component with async service -> Testing with a spy](https://imgur.com/gI8kwQC) [TypeError: jasmine.createSpyObj is not a function](https://imgur.com/b2spzRT) ## üî• Exception or Error 


 TypeError: jasmine.createSpyObj is not a function
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant? Jest doesn't have a function named [createSpyObj()](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52191258/typeerror-jasmine-createspyobj-is-not-a-function) like default jasmine has , please visit this link Jest createSpyObj which is a custom createSpyObj function in jest or just switch to jasmine instead.

Issues.Title: refactor(docs-infra): clean up CSS styles
Issues.Body:
This PR contains several refactoring commits that clean up our angular.io styles. All commits are refactorings (i.e. no feature/fix), so there should be no visual difference in the built app. (If there is, that is a mistake üò±)

See the individual commits for details. 

NOTES:
- Most commits are easier to review with whitespace changes ignored. (In GitHub, this can be achieved by appending `?w=1` to the URL.)
- I have tried to limit changes to a signle file/component in each commit (to keep them easier to review).
- There are three main types of clean-ups:
    - Removing unused styles.
    - Merging blocks that target the same elements.
    - Scope styles to specific components/elements.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(docs-infra): clean up CSS styles" (#40704)

Issues.Title: Issues developing libraries with VSCode
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/language-service (or @angular/cli?) ### Description When building/working on a library (that will packed into an npm package) I get either errors from Angular Language Service in VSCode or by the CLI when building depending on the setup. My base setup is: 1. Have a path in my tsconfig that points to my library in node_modules like so: ``` "paths": { "my-lib/*": [ "node_modules/my-lib/*" ] } ``` 2. Use a symlink by running `yarn link` in the library dist and then in the consuming workspace When using this setup, running `ng build` on the consuming app works fine. However, VSCode gives me red lines everywhere and none of the Angular Language Service features work. I read in [this stack overflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60102146/custom-library-component-is-not-a-known-element-but-app-compiles-and-runs) that ALS needs the `lib.metadata.json` file to work, and you get that by building the library with the `--prod` flag. When building the library with `--prod`, ALS works and building the app works for a little while, but after making some changes the build crashes and I get [this error](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/19635). The issue is closed and the solution is to not build with --prod since it's not Ivy. This would optimal for us since everything is private and we're only using new Angular versions (Ivy). However, not building with `--prod` gives the first error mentioned. ## üî• Exception or Error Firrst error: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6113944/106861522-2974a480-66c6-11eb-8443-b6039bf72530.png) Second error: 

An error occurred during the build:
Error: Tried to overwrite /Users/.../dist/my-lib/lib/components/hello-world/hello-world.component.d.ts.__ivy_ngcc_bak with an ngcc back up file, which is disallowed.
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.1.2
Node: 12.18.3
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.1.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router, upgrade
Ivy Workspace: Yes
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issues developing libraries with VSCode" (#40700)

Issues.Title: I18N is a pain in the ***
Issues.Body:
I'm working with angular since several years now and localization is a problem again and again.
First it starts with the question, how should the ecosystem around translation look like, what's the best practice here? There is no documentation, recommendation or help for the steps after extracting i18n.
It start's with the fact, that translations by default are not merged, so I added xliffmerge do my stack. That works pretty okay.
For doing translations I use [poedit](https://poedit.net) which is also a pretty nice tool.

But in the end I regularly get issues broken translations, because interpolation doesn't correctly find it self through the process or currently with this _Unexpected messageParts for `$localize` (expected an array of strings)._. This error message itself is already a pain because it's not helpful at all, because it actually just tells you "There is something wrong with your translations, good luck finding the bad one".

The problem for me is, that I really don't know who to "blame". Is angular not creating proper XLIFF files, is xliffmerge not merging them correctly or is poedit doing something wrong with my files. It's really frustrating to work with translations when beeing confronted with such errors.

So I really hope that the angular team can spend some time to add documentation about tools that are proven to work with angular. To think about integrating xliffmerge into angular CLI and to add more helpful error messages so that broken translations can be identified easier.

P.S.: Oh and what I forgot is prettier. It also adds to the mess because messages are wrapped or spaces are added which makes creating translations also harder.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "I18N is a pain in the ***" (#40702)

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): pull out interfaces on package toplevel (‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶#40621)

This is patch PR for #40621.

Two motivations behind this change:

1. We would like to expose the types of the Language Service to external
   users (like the VSCode extension) via the npm package, on the top
   level of the package
2. We would like the View Engine and Ivy LS to share a common interface
   (notably after the inclusion of `getTcb`, the Ivy LS upholds a
   strict superset of `ts.LanguageService`; previously both VE and Ivy
   LS were aligned on `ts.LanguageService`.)

To this end, this commit refactors the exports on the toplevel of the
`language-service/` package to just be types common to both the VE and
Ivy language services. The VE and Ivy build targets then import and use
these types accordingly, and the expectation is that an external user
will just import the relevant typings from the toplevel package without
diving into either the VE or Ivy sources.

Follow up on #40607

PR Close #40621

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): `readConfiguration` existing options should override options in tsconfig
Issues.Body:
**fix(compiler-cli): extend `angularCompilerOptions` in tsconfig from node**
TypeScript supports non rooted extends, we should do the same

https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/blob/b346f5764e4d500ebdeff7086e43690ea533a305/src/compiler/commandLineParser.ts#L2603-L2628

Closes: #36715


**refactor(bazel): use `readConfiguration` to read config file**
With this change we clean up the parsing of tsconfig files.



**fix(compiler-cli): `readConfiguration` existing options should override options in tsconfig**
At the moment, when passing an Angular Compiler option
in the `existingOptions` it doesn't override the defined in the TSConfig.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): `readConfiguration` existing options should override options in tsconfig" (#40694)

Issues.Title: dev-infra: linting fails for `BUILD.bazel` file and `ng-dev format files` does not fix the failure
Issues.Body:
In #40621, we run into a situation where the `ng-dev format ... --check` command (run as part of the `lint` job on CI) finds some formatting issues with a `BAZEL.build` file and fails. It suggests (or prompts the user) to run `ng-dev format files ...` to fix the issue, but that command does not fix the linting failure.

In that case, the problem was a glob pattern that included a constant string (see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40621#issuecomment-772482472). The fix was to manually change the pattern as follows:

```diff
-srcs = glob(["constant.string", "glob/*.pattern"]),
+srcs = ["constant.string"] + glob(["glob/*.pattern"]),
```

##
Not sure what is the best way to fix this. Ideally, we should suggest (or prompt the user) to run a command that actually fixes the error. If there is no such command, we should at least show the error message, so users can figure out how to manually fix it themselves.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "dev-infra: linting fails for `BUILD.bazel` file and `ng-dev format files` does not fix the failure" (#40690)

Issues.Title: Missing equiv-text and wrong line number from library in extracted i18n messages.xlf
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package This issue seems to be caused by a wrong source map generated by ngcc in `__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015` when using a library that contains localized messages and published for compatibility with the view engine (as recommended in https://v9.angular.io/guide/ivy#maintaining-library-compatibility). ### Is this a regression? I have not checked with a previous version of Angular. ### Description When using a library that contains localized messages and published for compatibility with the view engine (as recommended in https://v9.angular.io/guide/ivy#maintaining-library-compatibility), extracting localization messages with `ng extract-i18n` produces a [`messages.xlf`](https://github.com/divdavem/ngEquivTextBug/blob/master/myapp/messages.xlf#L6) file that does not contain any `equiv-text` attribute for the interpolation, and that has a wrong line number. Also, when looking at the generated source map in `__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015` with [source-map-visualization](http://sokra.github.io/source-map-visualization), it is obvious that there is a problem with the source map. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a library: ```sh ng new mylib --no-create-application cd mylib ng generate library mylib ``` Add the `i18n` attribute and a placeholder in `mylib.component.ts`: ```ts template: `

Hello {{name}}!

`, ``` Build the library in prod mode: ```sh ng build --prod ``` Then create an application: ```sh ng new myapp cd myapp ng add @angular/localize ``` Use the library in `package.json` in `myapp`: ```json { "dependencies": { ... Issues.Title: test(@angular/cli): allow invalid deps E2E to pass on release commits
Issues.Body: When installing an outdated version of `@schematics/angular`, the package manager will also analyze installed dependencies.  In the case of a release commit those dependencies are not yet on the npm registry and the outdated package install will fail. To remedy this situation, the outdated package and its two dependencies are published to the local test registry which allows the unreleased versions of the tooling packages to also be available to the package manager.

Issues.Title: Building shaders (.glsl)
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
It is not possible to build shaders for webGL. I tried to use @angular-builders/custom-webpack to add rule for importing .glsl files to ts files but it doesnt work because of .


### Describe the solution you'd like
I would be great to add ability to import shaders (import vertex from './my-vertex-shader.glsl'). It's a plain text actualy so it wont be a problem I think. 


### Describe alternatives you've considered
A lot of angular developers have to put shaders to assets and download them via http-client. But what if I dont want to make a request. It can be bad for users and it's not comfortable for developers. It's much easier to import it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Building shaders (.glsl)" (#19963)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): don't use `skipTemplateCodegen` to determine if compilation is JIT mode
Issues.Body:
With this change we add a new `jitMode` option to the ivy AngularWebpackPlugin.
`readConfiguration` from `@angular/compiler-cli` will use file configuration options over programmaticly supplied options. By using a separate option the options precedence issue can be avoided.

Closes #19949
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): don't use `skipTemplateCodegen` to determine if compilation is JIT mode" (#19953)

Issues.Title: ci: remove `validate-do-not-submit` check
Issues.Body:
This uses  `git merge-base --fork-point master` which currently is not yielding a SHA on the patch branch. In some cases merge-base will not working as expected when base is ahead. See https://public-inbox.org/git/xmqq375okvxy.fsf@gitster.mtv.corp.google.com/T/#r3830f032d76f39b82d0ffe7f8bd77351cf634d29

This validation checks if `DO_NOT_SUBMIT` string literal has been added using `git diff`, when present validation will fail.

This check is unneeded as we do not use the `DO_NOT_SUBMIT` pattern, as we typically use `wip!` commit message types.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: remove `validate-do-not-submit` check" (#19946)

Issues.Title: Allow failing build if there are missing runtime assets
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/cli


### Description
If you have in the assets configuration in `angular.json`:
```
    "assets": [
        ...
        {
            "glob": "jquery.min.js",
            "input": "./node_modules/jquery/dist",
            "output": "/assets/jquery"
        },
        ...
    ]
```

And the glob doesn't match anything, no error is generated. This means the build can be broken because the `assets` folder doesn't contain all required runtime assets, but we won't realize until runtime.

### Describe the solution you'd like
The feature request is to add an array field `files` that can be used instead of `glob` to tell exactly which files to copy: `"files": 
```
    "assets": [
        ...
        {
            "files": ["jquery.min.js", "jquery.min.map"],
            "input": "./node_modules/jquery/dist",
            "output": "/assets/jquery"
        },
        ...
    ]
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I considered listing the `jquery.min.js` file in the `scripts` section of `angular.json`, but this solution doesn't work perfectly for cases when it's not a "js" file I want in the assets folder. For example, mapbox comes with a folder with images, that I need copied to the assets folder.

An alternatively feature implementation I considered recommending was you could add an option `failIfNoMatch` to make the build fail if the glob doesn't match anything: `"failIfNoMatch": true`. But this solution is not as useful as the `files` one though, as the glob `jquery.min.{js,map}` would succeed even if it finds only one of the required files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow failing build if there are missing runtime assets" (#19952)

Issues.Title: LoggerApi.error should accept messages of type Error
Issues.Body:
### Description
`LoggerApi.error` only accept string messages:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/efb97c87f023497dc59a2f4fa3825a2ca78606da/packages/angular_devkit/core/src/logger/logger.ts#L91
 
When implementing a custom builder, we have to convert errors to strings before logging them with some logic like:
```ts
context.logger.error(error.stack ?? error.toString());
```


### Describe the solution you'd like
Would that make sense to move this logic inside the logger and change the signature to:
```ts
error(error: string | Error, ...)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "LoggerApi.error should accept messages of type Error" (#19951)

Issues.Title: How do I get Angular to ignore typescript 'errors'
Issues.Body:
I'm adding functionality to a large and complex Angular 11 application. I have `ng build watch` running and typically making large changes, testing them, and then iterating.

The biggest waste of my time at the moment is waiting for Angular to build a set of changes, go to test it, finding it's not working, then finding it's not working because the browser bundles haven't been updated and the code is stale because Typescript is pissed because there is an unused variable somewhere in the codebase.

Given the scale of the changes I'm making, time spent polishing the code to conform to every single Typescript rule ever invented, after every single change I make, when my current changes are still highly speculative and liable to change repeatedly just totally kills any productivity. Hunting down and 'fixing' the half dozen Typescript 'errors' that might occur just because I've commented out a line of code can be 10 minutes of my time that could be far better spend continuing with my work.

I would like either the IDE (VsCode) or the compiler to continue to make me aware of any Typescript issues so that I can use intelligence (that the tooling does not possess) to determine which errors to fix and when, but I do not want my builds continually failing for spurious stylistic issues.

Someone please tell me this is possible and how to achieve it.

P.S. There is absolutely no point whatsoever suggesting to people to seek answers to questions on StackOverflow. That site has been a total waste of time for years now.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66012370/how-do-i-get-angular-to-ignore-typescript-errors
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How do I get Angular to ignore typescript 'errors'" (#19948)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk): positionStrategy of an Overlay only works with Zone.js
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an Angular app without zone.js.
2. Create an `Overlay` with a `positionStrategy`.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The positionStrategy should be applied.

#### Actual Behavior

The positionStrategy gets not applied.

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.1.1
- CDK/Material: 11.1.1
- Browser(s): any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): any

I think the reason why this doesn't work is because the positionStrategy only gets applied after the zone became stable. However the [`NoopZone`](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/a3b08644280fb43d9dfd037927c4e6a48a2c9a46/packages/core/src/zone/ng_zone.ts#L420-L448) that Angular uses when being configured to not use zone.js doesn't fire a stable event.

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/d3deb8b9c61f79f6a4ab75d74914aac3b43592bf/src/cdk/overlay/overlay-ref.ts#L124-L134

To save others some time debugging this as well I think it would be helpful to log at least a warning in dev mode when someone uses the `NoopZone`.

I'm not sure though what could be a good fallback for apps without zone.js.

There is also a very brought ticket for supporting zone-less apps (#9169) which is somehow related. I thought it still makes sense to create a specific ticket for this problem. Please feel free to close it if everything regarding zone-less support should be tracked with the other one.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(cdk): positionStrategy of an Overlay only works with Zone.js" (#21786)

Issues.Title: Mat-select accessibility behavior different when component is in a mat-dialog
Issues.Body:
When using VoiceOver for macOS, the mat-select options will be read when the mat-select has focus and the keyboard arrow keys are used to navigate through each option in the list. However, if the component is used in a mat-dialog, you can still navigate through the select option with the arrow keys when the select has focus, but the VoiceOver screenreader does not read the option values. 

This forces our users that rely on VoiceOver to interact differently with mat-selects when they are part of a mat-dialog. Is this expected or could this be fixed to behave the same as when mat-selects are not in a mat-dialog?

I have attached the code from the app folder in a small sample app created to reproduce the issue.
[app.zip](https://github.com/angular/components/files/5918558/app.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mat-select accessibility behavior different when component is in a mat-dialog " (#21787)

Issues.Title: [Paginator] Please add hidePageRangeActions property for mat-paginator just like hidePageSize
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Hi, I was using mat-paginator and I wanted to give a feature request. I do not want range action div in paginator.
So can we add a property in mat paginator named as `@Input() hideRangeActions: boolean` just like `@Input() hidePageSize: boolean`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43669644/106751374-196dae00-664f-11eb-9708-401e7d02d727.png)


#### Use Case

If I have set the property hideRangeActions = "true" then below div will hide and only page size div will be coming

#### Validation
If I am using `mat-paginator` then **only one of the input property can be true not both** `hideRangeActions = "true" or hidePageSize = "true"`

Issues.Title: bug(Datepicker): Top left calender button has unclear purpose
Issues.Body:
Using the DatePicker for [selected years and months](https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview#watching-the-views-for-changes-on-selected-years-and-months). Typically I guess the user wants to use the month and year, and never the day. 

So by using the startView property to `multi-year` you will see the month and year in the select field:

![Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 17 57 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9882035/106781442-5b93f100-6649-11eb-83ca-58c9ca91fe6e.png)

Once you click on the icon the pop-up opens you are able to change the date.

**Current outcome:**

Here comes the bug. When you click on the button on the left top:

![Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 17 59 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9882035/106781879-d5c47580-6649-11eb-940d-f11b0282bc7b.png)

You will be able to select a day:

![Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 18 00 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9882035/106781940-e8d74580-6649-11eb-95ca-f5f74f80f5c3.png)

Why would you want to enable the user to select a day in a month and year calendar?

**Expected outcome:**

I was expecting instead that you would see the month that was selected. And if you'd click on it you would be sent to that year showing all the months. 

When setting the startView to year the button entirely does not need to be there. Or am I misinterpreting this whole thing?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Datepicker): Top left calender button has unclear purpose" (#21792)

Issues.Title: feat(DASHBOARD): TITLE  Enhance the Schematic to generate widgets with settings and a base class
Issues.Body:
#### The current Dashboard schematic should be enhanced with a better change/aggregator pattern, _such that_ the `contained ` widgets collection have some `base `common functionality.

#### Use Case
Hello, this is a request to enhance the Dashboard Schematic Generation.

Since business mostly use dashboards for reporting fragments of information\visuals\charts\tables across the organization and always house that data inside widgets; these widgets always contain _common basic_ plumbing that could be placed in a base class. However, that base is missing, if you could please enhance the Dashboard Schematic _**it would greatly benefit the developer community if a strategy/pattern was used in the dashboard component**_. These reports are data housed inside widgets form of charts, maps, tables etc.  However, in this schematic there is no UI aggregation, or common base settings.

**Dashboard**

- [ ] Typical dashboard is One (or many pages/tabs)
- [ ] Each Dashboard houses widgets/containers
- [ ] Be able to share change strategy with their contained widgets and other tabs
- [ ] DI` @Injectable` Service to accept new or remove old widgets

**Widgets** -

- [ ] Each of the widgets should extend from a base class
- [ ] The widget should share/exchange some common data with other widgets
- [ ] Widgets should have settings (an Icon gear, that can be extend, `Print, Copy, Export, Import, Refresh` etc.)
- [ ] Some lifecycle that allows them to clean up or change within that dashboards context


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21086190/106939093-cd257b00-66ed-11eb-877b-39b80cd33f25.png)

Some places have layed out information on this, because it was lacking.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21086190/106939914-e2e77000-66ee-11eb-869a-ddb8fddf659f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(DASHBOARD): TITLE  Enhance the Schematic to generate widgets with settings and a base class" (#21808)

Issues.Title: fix(material/dialog): focus restoration not working inside shadow dom
Issues.Body: Related to #21796. The dialog focus restoration works by grabbing `document.activeElement` before the dialog is opened and restoring focus to the element on destroy.  This won't work if the element is inside the shadow DOM, because the browser will return the shadow root. These changes add a workaround.

Issues.Title: bug(OverlayContainer): extending OverlayContainer cause build issues in angular 11
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. clone [this](https://github.com/rezres/Overlay-V11)
2. run ng build or serve
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
Expected Build to succeed, this was the case until we updated to angular 11


#### Actual Behavior
Build Error 
The directive MyOverlayService inherits its constructor from OverlayContainer, 
but the latter does not have an Angular decorator of its own. Dependency injection will not be able to resolve the parameters of OverlayContainer's constructor. Either add a @Directive decorator to OverlayContainer, or add an explicit constructor to MyOverlayService.

#### Environment
angular/cdk: 11.1.1
angular/common: 11.1.2
angular/compiler:  11.1.2
angular/core: 11.1.2

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/platform): adjust return type for _getShadowRoot
Issues.Body: The return type for `_getShadowRoot` is actually a `ShadowRoot`, not a `Node`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/platform): adjust return type for _getShadowRoot" (#21798)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): focus restoration not working inside shadow dom
Issues.Body:
Our focus restoration works by checking `document.activeElement` before the panel is opened and restoring to that element on close. The problem is that `activeElement` will return the shadow root, if the focused element is inside one.

These changes add some extra logic to account for it.

Fixes #21785.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): focus restoration not working inside shadow dom" (#21796)

Issues.Title: Support inserting row/column defs at specific indices rather than always appending
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

I'm trying to make table with 2 sticky header rows. First row should contain toolbar with table actions, but definition of this row is in separated file, it is passed through `cdkTable.addHeaderRowDef` . Second row should contain descriptions of columns. 

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I tried to manually position `headerRowDefinition` inside `_headerRowDefs` property, but I'm unable to do that due to:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/d3deb8b9c61f79f6a4ab75d74914aac3b43592bf/src/cdk/table/table.ts#L895
contentHeaderRowDefinitions specified explicit as content are always before customHeaderRowDefinitions added via `addHeaderRowDef`.

I tried to handle stickness by styling headers `postion: sticky` and calculate top positioning, but I'm unable to do that due to: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/d3deb8b9c61f79f6a4ab75d74914aac3b43592bf/src/cdk/table/table.ts#L731
All header rows have cleared top positioning value that I set via styling.

#### Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bkarpk?file=src/app/table/table.component.html
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 11.1.1
- CDK/Material: 11.1.1
- Browser(s): Chrome/Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support inserting row/column defs at specific indices rather than always appending " (#21791)

Issues.Title: bug(DatePicker): Focus Handling does not work with Shadow DOM
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz Demo: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-mlorwc?file=src/app/example-component.html
GitHub Repo: https://github.com/zie-rts/mat-datepicker-shadow-dom

The Stackblitz demo does not use custom elements (it did not work) and does not have any styling.
The GitHub repo uses custom elements, has some styling and also shows that the element is focused.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the stackblitz demo or clone the github repo (and run npm i + npm start)
2. Click on the datepicker button to open the calendar
3. Click on a date (the calender will be closed)

Step 2/3: Instead of clicking the datepicker button you can also focus the input element and press Alt+Arrow Down to open the calender and use the keyboard to select a date.
 
#### Expected Behavior

The previous focused element should be focused again.
That's either the datepicker button or the input element.

#### Actual Behavior

Angular Material sets the focus to the element that was previously focused.
If the datepicker field is used inside Shadow DOM the shadow root element will be focused. As this will not be focusable most of the time the body element will receive the focus. If we set tabindex="-1" on the element we can see that the element gets the focus (see GitHub repo).


#### Environment

- Angular: 11.1.1
- CDK/Material: 11.1.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DatePicker): Focus Handling does not work with Shadow DOM" (#21785)
